cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars take part in the biological process of pollination.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism functions as a pollinator contributing to the pollination process of the object.
remarks: Biological plausibility check: Caterpillars are typically not primary pollinators; this instance may reflect a source statement or a mistaken upstream inference, not a general ecological fact.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies play a crucial role in the process of pollination.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism functions as a pollinator contributing to the pollination process of the object.

args.remark: Biological plausibility check: Caterpillars are typically not primary pollinators; this instance may reflect a source statement or a mistaken upstream inference, not a general ecological fact.
args.justification: Schema fields (canonical_rel_name, rel_cls, rel_cls_group) are consistent, but the factual/ecological validity of caterpillars acting as pollinators is questionable and should be flagged for human review rather than changed at the schema level.
